intro: Rubus vestifer, commonly known as the hairy blackberry, is a species of brambles belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. Due to its hardy nature, it plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing food for wildlife and stabilizing soil.
